channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 161 Blendon Rd The Local - front extension of shop, 29th July
item.description:
161 Blendon Road The Local Off-licence has installed a raised concrete area on the footpath and sectioned the area off. Covered it with a plastic canopy and are trading from within this area. Is this legal? Doesn't this require planning permission? Also for YEARS they have suitated their big red BIFFA bin outside on the footpath. And there are also pallets left up against the pedestrian railings. This area looks a mess and creates a hazard to the public especially those with disabilities and the bin a potential environmental hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Blendon Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers have been put up on Murrain Road., 29th July
item.description:
Barriers keep being put up typically mid to late afternoon. This blocks the road for cyclists meaning they have to use the footpath. This may cause an accident between the cyclist and and pedestrians. Could these please be removed. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Murrain Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of rubbish in estate bin store, 29th July
item.description:
Someone has dumped alot of various rubbish in the bin store behind 1-11 millpond estate. Bed frame, mattress, TV, furniture, black bags, couple of medicine boxes (just thought - maybe they'll have a address on them?). Also loose pillows, clothing etc. takes up most of the bin store
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bermondsey Wall East, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights on Gordon House Rd turning right into Highgate Rd safety issue, 29th July
item.description:
When turning right and using the right hand lane to enter Highgate Rd from Gordon House Rd, driver currently give way on a green light to traffic entering Gordon House Rd from Chetwynd Rd. There is no filter light so cars often enter the pedestrian crossing, and there is often confusion between drivers. As a result, I have witnessed numerous near misses, and cars blocking the pedestrian crossing. It would be beneficial to have a filter light for right-turning vehicles, so all are co didnâ€™t with right of way, and the pedestrian crossing is always clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 157, Highgate Road, Dartmouth Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped on bins, 29th July
item.description:
Neighbours bins A never emptied and rubbish dumped on top of overflowing bins. Causing an eye sore for adjacent residents and also an attraction to vermin to cause even more mess on top of what others have created.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Nuxley Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree appears to be dieing. Requires dealing with, 29th July
item.description:
This large tree appears to be dieing/dead. All the leaves have shedded off it and it is the only tree like this in the road. It has ivy growing up and appears quite worse for wear. Leaves have all shrivelled and died. It is a large tree right next to large houses so is potentially dangerous. It has been like this for the last few weeks. Could this tree be attended to and/or removed please. I know a similar size tree down the road similar happened to and you removed it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Magpie Hall Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on pavements-whole stretch Woolwich new road, 29th July
item.description:
There are rubbish piling up on pavement and channels where the street meets pavement along this whole road: Woolwich New Road. There wasnâ€™t any cleaners coming around sweeping rubbish away for many weeks. Itâ€™s a busy road and many people walk up and . Please could you kindly ask a dedicated cleaner to focus on this whole street. It would be nice if this whole stretch of road could be swept and tidied up asap. Itâ€™s rubbish from Gordon Sq on Woolwich New Road and goes right up to top of the road , passing the St Peterâ€™s apostle. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich New Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please Clean Dunsmure Road South Side, 29th July
item.description:
Please clean constant litter, rubbish, fly tipping and left recycling bags on the entire south side of Dunsmure. This is a weekly issue yet I donâ€™t see weekly cleaners unlike on Wilderton. Itâ€™s worse on Tuesdays (recycling days). Please send someone weekly
